H1085.def: = man; ◄ {L:Shuhite<SDBH:שׁוּחִי>}; ► friend of {L:Job<SDBH:אִיֹּוב>} who comes to comfort but concludes by arguing with Job

H7747.def: = member of ethnic group ◄ possibly founded by {L:Shuah<SDBH:שׁוּחַ>}, son of {L:Abraham<SDBH:אַבְרָהָם>} and {L:Keturah<SDBH:קְטוּרָה>}

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H575.def: = referent to an unknown location; ► normally used with the purpose of finding which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found

H4448.def: = process by which plants and their products become devoid of moisture, and therefore lose color and bend over ◄ as if in mourning, ► which may ultimately result in death if circumstances do not change; ≈ associated with drought and destruction, often as punishment from God

H428.def: = marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

H561.def: = words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded

H3524.def: = state in which humans, deities or substances have great power and strength

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H5791.def: = process by which something becomes bent or twisted out of shape or position

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H7706.def: = deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All-sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God

H6664.def: = state in which a weight or measure is correct or accurate, in accordance with a standard

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H6588.def: = action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H7836.def: = process by which the color of an object turns darker until it is (almost) black

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H7706.def: = deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All-sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God

H2603.def: = state in which humans or deities are favorably disposed to (other) humans, and act accordingly

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H2134.def: = state in which a substance has not been mixed or adulterated with any other substance

H3477.def: = state in which objects are without a bend or curve

H6258.def: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

H5782.def: = process by which someone wakes up from his sleep

H6664.def: = state in which a weight or measure is correct or accurate, in accordance with a standard

H7225.def: = point in time at which an event starts happening

H4705.def: = an object that is relatively small in size

H319.def: = pertaining to being located far behind other objects in a row, in a direction away from the spectator; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was with their backs facing the East, this term presupposes a westerly direction

H7685.def: = process by which a plant grows in size

H7223.def: = state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range

H3559.def: = state in which an object is firmly and immovably located in a certain place

H2714.def: = action by which someone makes an effort to obtain information about events

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H587.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse, including those associated to him or her

H8543.def: = reference to the day before the current day; sometimes used to refer to a point of time in the recent past as if it happened the day before

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H4405.def: used in poetry only; = a single distinct meaningful element of speech or writing, used to form sentences with others

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H1573.def: = tall sedge with a smooth triangular stem, and multiple drooping, clustered flower stalks arising from the apex of the main stalk; ◄ |iCyperus papyrus|i*, found in the {L:Nile<SDBH:יְאֹר>} valley; ► used for many different purposes in the Ancient Near East, such as writing material, ships, mattresses, furniture, rope, sandals, etc.

H1342.def: = process by which plants and other inanimate objects increase in height

H1207.def: = an area of low-lying land which is flooded in wet seasons or at high tide, and typically remains waterlogged at all times; a place where {L:reeds<SDBH:קָנֶה>} and {L:papyrus<SDBH:גֹּמֶא>} grow

H260.def: = type of grass; ◄ found on the borders of the {L:Nile<SDBH:יְאֹר>}; ► eaten by cattle

H7685.def: = process by which a plant grows in size

H1097.def: = particle marking a proposition as not true

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H3.def: = part of a plant or tree that is typically surrounded by brightly colored petals and will eventually develop into a fruit

H6998.def: = causative action by which humans remove leaves, branches, fruits, or the entire stalk of a plant

H3001.def: = process by which objects containing liquid essential to their existence lose these liquids ◄ due to some external or internal cause

H734.def: = relatively narrow {L:road<SDBH:דֶּרֶךְ>} that connects two locations and facilitates travelling

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H2611.def: = state in which humans are impure in character, without regard or respect for God

H6.def: = state of not being located in the place where it is expected to be

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H3689.def: = area of the body located on both sides of the spine between the ribs the the hip; location where fat can accumulate

H6990.def: = to experience a deep loathing for a person or condition

H4009.def: = state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH

H5908.def: = eight-legged creature that produces silken strands of web in which they catch their prey, mainly flying insects, such as flies, grasshoppers, and the like; ≈ associated with what is temporary and fragile

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H8172.def: = state in which humans rest part of their body, such as their back or their arms, on an object that provides support, such as a tree or stick

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H5975.def: = process by which humans, deities, animals, or inanimate objects take position in a certain location in an upright position

H2388.def: = state in which humans or deities are strong in a physical, political, or military sense, or simply in their ability to convince others with words

H8121.def: = celestial body ► that marks day and night and produces warmth and light for the earth

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H3127.def: = young branch growing from the stump or stem of a tree or plant

H1593.def: = a fenced portion of land, ► used for growing flowers, plants, and vegetables, but also as a burial place; ≈ associated with beauty and fragrance

H8328.def: = a part of a plant normally below ground, which acts as a support and collects water and nourishment, ≈ associated with well-being, offspring, and the inclination of the mind

H1530.def: = a ridge of water curling into an arched form between two depressions in open water

H2372.def: = process by which someone perceives an important object with the eyes, or witnesses an event of some significance

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H68.def: = hard, heavy, and strong substance, ◄ very commonly found in nature,  ► which can be hewn into different shapes by a craftsman

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H1104.def: = action by which humans or animals cause food to pass down from their mouth to their esophagus; ≈ often used figuratively to denote destruction and death

H4725.def: = a specific area or point in space

H3584.def: = process by which humans lose body volume ◄ as a result of sickness or fasting

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H4885.def: poetic term; = state in which humans, deities, and animals feel and show great joy

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H312.def: = pertaining to being different from other objects and events that are in the same range

H6779.def: = process by which plants, trees, or hairs come up and start growing; ≈ sometimes extended to denote the coming in existence of people, conditions, or activities

H6083.def: = the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3988.def: = state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events

H8535.def: literally: completed; hence: = state in which two objects have been made into one

H2388.def: = state in which humans or deities are strong in a physical, political, or military sense, or simply in their ability to convince others with words

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H7489.def: literally: to make (one's deeds) wrong; hence: = action by which humans behave in an evil or harmful way

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H7814.def: = action by which humans give expression to a friendly attitude, joy and amusement with the gestures and sounds that normally accompany it; ≈ this is normally regarded as a good thing, especially when done with restraint, whereas a lack of restraint is often associated with foolishness

H8643.def: = loud sound ◄ produced either by the human voice or by musical instruments ► used to express an emotion or to communicate something to a community

H8130.def: = state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice

H3847.def: = state in which humans wear certain clothes, often for a specific purpose

H1322.def: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

H168.def: = construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

4.gl: to be clothed (with a certain state)
